review_text: I have used the Bosch Icons on all of my cars since they hit the market years ago.  Like a lot of people.  I have been through many different brands and types of wipers, but I find that these Icons give me the overall performance I am looking for.  I change the windshield wipers on my cars every year at the end of the summer, because I live in the central valley, ca where summers are in the triple digits and the air is fairly dry.  So summers take a toll on the wipers rubber.  I have never had any problems with Bosch Icons.  Every pair that I have purchased have been great and performed well.  I stick with these because they just have a lot of attributes that other wipers do not have.  These wipers are frameless so they hug the contour of the windshield instead of just sitting on top of the windshield which can leave lines of water on the windshield.  They perform very well at high speeds.  With some wipers aerodynamics wasn't taken into account, so what happens is at high speeds the wipers begin to lift ever so slightly away from the windshield loosing their ability to remove all the water from the windshield efficiently.  With the design of these Bosch Icons though.  They are pushed into the windshield at high speeds so you dont loose performance.  These also do not cause any wind noise at high speeds.  The sleek design of these just looks great.  Most importantly these wipers just do a fantastic job at moving every dropping of water off of the windshield.  I recommend picking these up and some of the RainX Washer Fluid additive.  The additive makes the water bead up on the windows and makes it easier for the wipers to completely remove it.  The Icons work great with out it, but the additive just make them that much better

These are more expensive, but last longer and have noticeably better performance. I find that these also respond well to reconditioning if you clean them well with alcohol periodically.

review_text: Loved these blades. I tried them years ago and did not have a good experience so I ended up settling with the Bosch Evolutions. I have a 2007 Outlander which called for "A" type on the driver's side, which is standard and "B" type on the passenger's side as sometimes called for. By mistake I ordered two "A" type blades. I was just about to return the passenger's side for a "B" type as indicated but I decided to try the "A" anyway. Installed and worked great. product_title: Bosch ICON 21A Wiper Blade, Up to 40% Longer Life* - 21" (Pack of 1)
review_text: There are some things I am a fanatic about.  Good wipers are one of those things.  The “experts” are now suggesting we change our wipers every six months.  (I wonder if they have stock in a wiper company?)  Of course so many other factors go in to the mix including whether you keep your car in the garage to how much your wipers are actually used.  Purchasing wipers has become as complicated as decided what athletic shoe to buy?  Do you want them to run, walk, sit, bike?  Why do we allow things to get this complicated?  That being said, if you are here you are doing the right thing.  You are conducting a little research to hopefully obtain the best wiper for the best price.  The first thing I will share is, as I’m sure you already know, there are plenty of blades out there for a lot less money.  Let’s talk about the price difference.  Assuming this is one of the best on the market, and the lowest price blade is one of the worst, we are looking at three times the cost.  The truth is 21” wiper blades can be easily found for $5 or $6 each.  Why then did I pay $17?  Bosch has found a way to distribute the same pressure throughout the entire blade while it clears away snow and/or water.  This is important.  I understand the “rubber” they use is actually a “blend” which keeps the operation silent, longer.  They also advertise their blades come without hinges and brackets.  Quite possibly this could equate to less things to “break”.  It should be noted this is advertised as an “all weather condition” wiper.  This may be “overkill” for some, or a really, really good wiper for others.  I reside in Southern New Jersey where we can get a little snow from time to time.  I wanted a wiper to work like a squeegee and remove all water with a swipe.  It should be noted, that is exactly what happens with both the driver side and passenger side.  With one swipe ALL water is removed.  No streaks, no lines, no funny stuff.  Bosch claims their wipers can last up to 40% longer.  I’m not sure what that means.  Longer than what, the cheapest blade?  I have no doubt, from the feel and the look, these blades will last longer than some other blades.  I do know I was rather surprised during the first rain event.  They were remarkable.  Will they last?  I hope so?  Will they continue to perform?  I hope so.  Are they worth the money?  In my humble opinion they are very, very good wipers.  However, $17. is still a little high for a piece of rubber on a stick.  So for that reason I have chosen to rate this item at 4 stars.  Should the price come down a bit and these wipers perform well for a period of time, I will purchase them and rate them 5 stars next time.

review_text:
I've been through countless sets of wipers on countless cars over the years, and I can honestly say these have been the best wipers ever in my long history of windshield wipers.

This is in stark contrast to the Anco wipers I used previously, which were a nightmare to put on due to the latching mechanism. Once installed, the first wipe was breathtaking. No chatter whatsoever, just a perfect, silent glide across the windshield. The wipers get the windshield as clear as if I'd washed it by hand.

product_title: Bosch ICON 21A Wiper Blade, Up to 40% Longer Life* - 21" (Pack of 1)
review_title: They lasted through two Boston winters
review_text:
I've had these on my car for a little over a year and a half. (I know, because Amazon just reminded me of my prior order as I checked out the product page to order another set.) Only now are they starting to show signs of aging. Before these, I had wipers from Rain-X (two different kinds) and while they cost about 75% as much, they lasted 30% of the time. You do the math.
In case you're not familiar with them, Bosch is the company that actually makes the OEM wiper blades for many high end cars (like BMW, for one). In fact, you'd probably be surprised by how much inside your car is made by Bosch. So, you're not buying from a company that is just marketing cheap parts made in China and selling it with a lot of marketing. You're getting OEM quality with these, if not better. So, when considered in that light, as well, these blades really aren't that expensive.
They don't streak or chatter, and even after having them on my car for over a year, they are only streaking a small amount. That's saying something, as these have now made it through two Boston winters.
So, the blades really do last, but will you be happy with them while they do? I think so. They hold the shape of the windshield well, and never flap or vibrate, no matter how fast you're going. The bracket is solid, and worked well on the J-hook in my car. Many other "universal" mounts didn't work so well, notably the ones from the aforementioned Rain-X wipers. The single piece design is also great for those living in cold climates, as it is less vulnerable to ice and snow build-up.
Given that your eyes are the most important safety device on your car, you owe it to yourself to not skimp on wiper blades. But I'm pleased to report that despite the upfront cost, these are actually MORE cost effective than many other premium wiper blades, given that they are the only expensive wiper blades I've ever used that actually lasted longer than the cheap ones.
Tip: the A or the B after the model number (e.g. 22A) refers to the spring force of the blade (i.e. how hard it is to pull it straight). The B applies more force, and would be useful if you have a highly curved windshield. The fact that Bosch offers not just a variety of lengths down the inch, but also two different spring forces, is another indicator of the fact that these are not your average wiper blades. I found that having an A on the driver side and a B on the passenger side works best on my car. If in doubt, just try A all around, and then if you find that the blade is missing spots on the ends of the blade, return the A and get a B.
Last tip: Amazon's database is helpful, but by no means complete. If you think this will fit your car, but Amazon says it won't, ignore Amazon. They say neither blade I have on my car will work, and yet I'm extremely happy with them, as you can tell.

In my experience, these style blades also last longer, so spend the extra 5-10 dollars to get a better blade, you'll thank yourself later and in the end it truly is a safety item which you shouldn't be skimping on.

review_title: Amazing for my Mazda 3, I can see!!
review_text:
I knew I needed new wipers for my car, but I did not think there was a difference in them. I had Rainx ones on my car (Maxda 3) but could not see out of the driver's side when it rained. Recently driving home from my mother's on a long interstate road and not being able to see much of anything while it down poured, I knew I needed new wipers.
I saw the raving reviews for Bosch and owning other products of theirs, I knew they were quality. I did not want to wait so I went to my local shopping store hoping to get a pair. I found Bosch and figured they would all be about the same. I came home and the one I bought from the store had a terrible diagram and I could not get it installed for the life of me. I even had this stranger who offered to help me that saw I was struggling and he could not get it on my car. I then noticed it had a crack on the side. This is still the Bosch one but locally bought. I went to Bosch's website and notice the wiper was not even in their inventory, it must have been old.
I then came online and placed my order fearful it would not fit. The selling point for me was the video Mr.Erb placed up showing how easy it was to install. The store bought one had parts and whatnot, this one literally snaps in place. As odd as it might sound, I opted to only buy the driver's side. That was the side I could not see out of and wanted to compare them. I installed the blade in seconds, it was so simple! Now the test was, when the rain came in.
When it rained I was so exited to try the new wiper. Appearance wise, the Bosch just looks cool. Not a reason to buy it but it is nice that it sits low and is attractive. I was shocked at how well it cleaned the windshield when it rained! I am used to missing spots but the Bosch hugged my windshield and wiped all of the rain away. I looked over at what was still my good wiper, the Rainx one and it could not compare. It was missing spots and also was loud.
I knew Bosch made quality products but did not know they made such great wipers. I have since ordered one for the passenger side and will continue to buy these. I am very impressed with how well they work!
